text:
Hi David. Nice to meet you. Also, thanks for taking time chat. Much appreciated. 

I’m currently working at an architectural company in central London as a visualisation artist in the Lighting team. And have been doing so for the last 7 years. I studied computer visualisation and animation at Ravenbourne and graduated in 2010. I’ve always been looking move into the entertainment industry ever since. 

The team I currently work with need visualisation support for client presentations etc. But its always abit as and when. Ive been developing my portfolio over the last 3 years or so to focus more on concept art and attempting to expand into 3d more to avoid narrowing my job options. 

I noticed you currently work at Framestore. I worked there briefly after graduation as a Runner. Feels like a while back now though :joy:

Hi Sam! Great to hear from you.

I’m intrigued by your work in lighting in archviz, do you have any examples? Also I have no idea what software you use or are used to etc. But it sounds like you have a good background and experience to make the move into entertainment/film/tv so I guess it’s just about presenting your work in the right way and plugging any gaps. I have so much advice on getting into the industry as I didn’t do it so long ago. And although I came through a masters degree I know lots of different routes (having tried a few myself!)

Yes I’m at Framestore at the moment, I’ve been here for three years. It’s really good that you had runner experience here, there’s probably a lot of the same people still knocking around!

Do you have a specific area of the industry you want to get into? Or dream projects to work on?
